description: Binary encoding of factorizations, alternative 2, a(n) = bef2(n);.
comments: Gives same values as A048675 if the source sequence is squarefree (A048672), or there are max two prime divisors or one p with max exponent being 2 (A048623 and A048639).
maple: bef2 := proc(n) local s,d; s := 0; for d in ifactors(n)[ 2 ] do s := s + (2^(nthprime(d[ 1 ])+d[ 2 ]-2)); od; RETURN(s); end; # for nthprime see A048675
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {if (n==1, return (0)); my(f = factor(n)); sum(k=1, #f~, 2^(primepi(f[k, 1])+f[k, 2]))/4;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 02 2015
author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 14 1999
